item.title: Picker or road sweeper ü•¥, 18th August
item.description:
Ok so last week the weeds were sprayed can u please educate the picker/road sweeper? how to use a broom to üßπclear the weeds , I've never seen him once using a üßπ hence why I put picker/sweeper I've seen other road sweepersüòç but not this lazy one an inspection is required Thanks üëç

item.title: Dumped house rubbish, 18th August
item.description:
Dumped house rubbish, including what looks like plaster board (not good for public health). Rats seen running in and out and local cats use the pile as a toilet so bad smell. It is also resting against the fence which is on a public pavement causing the fence to dangerously lean onto the public pavement. Looks like an accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, rubbish, tea detritus, broken glass on footbridge, 18th August
item.description:
Footbridge over railway between both sides of Gipsy Road is filthy dirty, has broken glass, litter and a huge amount of tree detritus on it. Some of the rubbish, particularly old chip wrapping has been there for more than a month. This has been reported before but no action taken thus far. The steps and nosings are dirty with accumulated filth that requires washing off. This bridge is still quite new but you wouldn't know to look at it. Bexley Council, please correct this deplorable situation and make Welling a pleasant and safe place to live.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gipsy Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to Guard Rails again - possible exposed prongs, 18th August
item.description:
Hello - sorry another coach is reported to have damaged the guard rails at this point. There is no Parking Bay marked here but some inconsiderate drivers continue to park here. For this instance TfL Victoria Coach Station have numberplates and photo evidence of the 'believed coach' if this assists with any claiming.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123/151, Buckingham Palace Road, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contractors damaged footpath, 18th August
item.description:
Some contractors instructed by a private residence, having blocked the footpath to push chair and wheelchair uses for several days. Have left a significant amount of debris and mess - along with completely destroying the grass and various parts of the footpath. I suggest they be held accountable for fixing and cleaning up their mess

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Avenue, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
